list_definition.definition: the practice or art of a surgeon
a doctor’s or dentist’s room in which he examines patients.

list_ex_of_english: Management options will be discussed again after cardiac catheterisation, and then when the child is admitted for surgery.
Despite permanent weight loss after surgery, there is no difference in blood pressure compared to untreated controls in long-term followup.
The lowest benefit patients are those without central nervous problems, sepsis, and respiratory failure, 30 years of age, after elective surgeries.
A 22-month-old boy was referred for corrective cardiac surgery.
The benefits of micro-robotic surgery are now becoming apparent and undoubtedly we will see similar procedures developed for a variety of operations in the future.
Although in its present form the system is quite reasonable for most routine surgery, it is far from perfect.
None of the patients had responded to medical therapy and each underwent surgery as a semiurgent procedure.
This study was performed to find out about the queue discipline in waiting lists for elective surgery to reveal potential discrepancies in waiting list management.
